chinese: [C] a belief or idea of what a particular type of person or thing is like 模式化的思想；老一套；旧框框
examples: e.g. Current evidence indicates that older people are more healthy than popular [[stereotypes]] suggest.

chinese: [U] the fact of being important and well-known 重要；杰出；著名
examples: e.g. His rise to [[prominence]] would not have been possible without the war.

chinese: 1) [U] feelings of pity, love, sadness, etc. that are often considered to be too strong or not suitable for a particular situation 多愁善感；感情因素
examples: e.g. He was overwhelmed by [[sentiment]] as he thought of his wife.；e.g. Public [[sentiment]] is against any change to the law.

chinese: 2) [C, U] (fml.) an opinion or feeling you have about sth. 意见；观点；感想
examples: e.g. He was overwhelmed by [[sentiment]] as he thought of his wife.；e.g. Public [[sentiment]] is against any change to the law.

chinese: having the qualities or appearance considered to be typical of women; connected with women （指气质或外貌）女性特有的；女性的
examples: e.g. Amelia's report describes the experience from a [[feminine]] point of view.

chinese: connected with literature 文学的；文学上的
examples: e.g. In a [[literary]] essay, you should explore the meaning and construction of the text.

chinese: having feelings that are typical of a caring mother toward a child 母性的；母亲般慈爱的
examples: e.g. She seems to have a strong [[maternal]] instinct.

chinese: to a much greater level or degree than seems reasonable or appropriate 过度地；过多地
examples: e.g. The country relies [[excessively]] on borrowing from abroad.

chinese: [C, U] the fact of being male or female 性别
examples: e.g. It is a country where [[gender]] roles have remained largely unchanged.

chinese: [C, U] the unfair difference between groups of people in society, when some have more wealth, status, or opportunities than others 不平等；不平衡；不平均
examples: e.g. There has been an increase in economic [[inequality]] between different areas of the country.

chinese: [U, sing.] an unfair personal opinion that influences your judgment 偏见；成见；偏心
examples: e.g. It's clear that the company has a [[bias]] against women.

chinese: [C] a magazine, esp. one about a serious or technical subject 期刊
examples: e.g. Readers will find a complete list of [[periodicals]] dealing with that subject.

chinese: [C, U] the act of printing a book, a magazine, etc. and making it available to the public; a book, a magazine, etc. that has been published （书刊等的）出版，发行；出版物
examples: e.g. That professor was the author of 70 major scientific [[publications]].

chinese: (BrE analyse) examine or think about sth. carefully, in order to understand it 分析；剖析
examples: e.g. We use a special computer program to [[analyze]] all the sales figures.

chinese: recognize and correctly name sb. / sth. 认出，识别（某人或某物）
examples: e.g. Passengers were asked to [[identify]] their own suitcases before they were put on the plane.

chinese: [C, U] a statement, letter, etc. that shows that sth. is true, correct, or definite 证实；证明
examples: e.g. I'm still waiting for [[confirmation]] of the test results.

chinese: acting or happening in a way that is expected 可预料的；可预见的
examples: e.g. In March and April, the weather in this area is much less [[predictable]].

chinese: very unusual or surprising 异乎寻常的；令人惊奇的
examples: e.g. These myths have a [[startling]] likeness to one another.

chinese: having a quality or characteristic that makes sth. different and easily noticed 特有的；特别的；有特色的
examples: e.g. Whatever you think of his poetry, it's certainly [[distinctive]].

chinese: exactly the same, or very similar 完全相同的；极为相似的
examples: e.g. The picture is [[identical]] to the one in The Museum of Modern Art in New York.

chinese: (only before noun) done in a planned and determined way, esp. by more than one person, government, country, etc. 齐心协力的；一致的
examples: e.g. Libraries have made a [[concerted]] effort to attract young people.

chinese: [C] a serious speech or piece of writing on a particular subject （关于某主题的）演讲，论述，著述
examples: e.g. Hastings responds with a lengthy [[discourse]] on marketing strategies.

chinese: (fml.) relating to amounts rather than to the quality or standard of sth. （数）量的；与数量有关的；定量的
examples: e.g. We need to do a proper [[quantitative]] analysis of this problem.

chinese: [U] the fact of having sb. to speak, vote, or make decisions for you 代理；代表
examples: e.g. Minority groups need more effective parliamentary [[representation]].

chinese: not serious, important, or valuable 微不足道的；没有什么价值的
examples: e.g. I know it sounds [[trivial]], but I'm worried about it.

chinese: easy to see or notice; clear or definite 显著的；显而易见的
examples: e.g. Road noise tends to be more [[noticeable]] in certain weather conditions.

chinese: 1) hide sth. or change it, so that it cannot be recognized 掩蔽；掩饰
examples: e.g. The speech was seen by many as a thinly [[disguised]] attack on the president.；e.g. He [[disguised]] himself by wearing a false beard.

chinese: 2) change sb.'s appearance so that people cannot recognize them 装扮；假扮
examples: e.g. The speech was seen by many as a thinly [[disguised]] attack on the president.；e.g. He [[disguised]] himself by wearing a false beard.

chinese: 1) (of feelings, thoughts, etc.) existing or happening without you realizing or being aware; not deliberate or controlled （感情、思想等）无意识的，未意识到的
examples: e.g. He seems to be driven by an [[unconscious]] desire to do better than everyone else.；e.g. They found him lying [[unconscious]] on the floor.

chinese: 2) unable to see, move, feel, etc. in the normal way because you are not conscious 不省人事的；失去知觉的
examples: e.g. He seems to be driven by an [[unconscious]] desire to do better than everyone else.；e.g. They found him lying [[unconscious]] on the floor.

chinese: [C] a person or company whose business is to arrange the writing, production, and sale of books, newspapers, etc. （书、报纸等的）出版者，出版商；出版社
examples: e.g. The [[publisher]] planned to produce the journal on a weekly basis.

chinese: continue doing an activity or trying to achieve sth. over a long period of time 追求；继续进行
examples: e.g. Students should [[pursue]] their own interests, as well as do their school work.

chinese: [U] the practice of treating one person or group differently from another in an unfair way 歧视
examples: e.g. Laws have got to be tougher to stop [[discrimination]] against the disabled.

chinese: etc.
examples: become important, famous, powerful, etc. 变得杰出、著名、强大等
column4: e.g. She played an important supporting role in the family as her husband [[rose to fame]] as an actor.

chinese: at issue or in question 待解决的；成问题的
examples: e.g. His own personal future was [[at stake]].

chinese: 简・奥斯汀（英国小说家）
(George Henry Lewes)乔治・亨利・刘易斯（英国哲学家、文学评论家和剧作家）
乔治・艾略特（英国小说家）
